TopicTitle: Why have they stopped posting show an tells

Articles.Content:
On 11/29/2021 at 4:54 PM, KSP Star said:

Hello all, just want to chime in here.

First, I took some time away from my position starting back in Oct to take care of some personal matters.  You'll see me on here more often again as I get re-settled into my previous role.

Second, as I've mentioned before, there was no set release cadence for KSP2 Show and Tells specifically. We've been able to regularly show some sort of new KSP2 content whether it was Show and Tell, a Dev Diary, a Feature Video, etc., but a lot of work goes into planning and creating the various KSP2 content that is shared with you all, and the process takes some time. (Sometimes weeks, sometimes months) We do plan to continue to share more KSP2 content with you, but the amount of content and the frequency in which it will be shared with you will continue to vary.

So no, nothing terrible has happened, and if there are a few Fridays where you don't see any Show and Tells, there's no reason to worry. Show and Tell isn't done with. There will be more! As for when, you'll have to stay tuned. As you know, we always share Show and Tell content here first, so you'll be the first to know when the next Show and Tell goes up.  

Thats great to hear!

 

Glad nothing bad is happening

What is the thing you guys would like to see the most in the next show and tell regardless of when it will be?

I would like to see how rovers would feel to drive around and if the wheels will leave grooves in the soil.

Hi friends. And thanks to @KSP Star for dropping in to give you all an update. 

Things have been BUSY! This team has really hit a fever pitch and we on the creative/design end of the pipeline are having to really hustle to keep up with the high speed of production (not to mention, as more features come online, we also have an increasing number of review/polish tasks popping up as well). And you will not be surprised to hear that this is a very, very big game, so there's a lot to keep track of. I sometimes feel like Lucille Ball tending the conveyor belt.

Anyway, the game's going great. Our absence has been evidence of our cup running over, not evidence of something bad happening. We'll have something neat to show you very soon. Thanks as always for your patience.

1 hour ago, coyotesfrontier said:

Source? That seems a bit far fetched.

Financial results of T2 for the first quarter of fiscal 2022 (from October) fell compared to the same period last year. By the way, in the financial statistics, KSP 2 is scheduled for the fiscal year 2023, that is, October 2022 - September 2023. NBA 2K22 turned out to be not as popular as it was expected, GTA 3 too. Is there any doubt that a large corporation has no idea that revenue can fall along with its reputation? GTA online cannot bring more and more money forever! And shareholders want profits to always increase. If I were Strauss Zelnick, I would send a letter to every studio that it's time to start crunching, especially in those games that have already been postponed. Indeed, in his place, I would not want another Chairman and Chief Executive Officer to be elected at the shareholders' meeting.
